techmeme.title: LA-based GrayMatter Robotics, which develops AI-powered robotic cells for the manufacturing industry, raised a $45M Series B led by Wellington Management (Mike Wheatley/SiliconANGLE)
Gynger, which lets companies "finance, pay, and manage" their tech purchases, raised a $20M Series A led by PayPal Ventures, bringing its total raised to $31.7M (Mary Ann Azevedo/TechCrunch)
Anthropic debuts Artifacts, which lets users see and interact with the results from Claude requests, signaling its long-term vision for companies to use Claude (David Pierce/The Verge)
Anthropic launches Claude 3.5 Sonnet, which beats its flagship model Claude 3 Opus and outperforms GPT-4o in some tests, available for free on the web and iOS (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
HeyGen, which uses AI to let users create realistic-looking avatars, raised $60M led by Benchmark at a $500M valuation, taking its total funding to $74M (Rachel Metz/Bloomberg)
